column4: if i can transfer files to my PSP in win but not linux whats the problem, linux automounts and shows the filesystem and it will look like it works till i try to play them and they dont exist, when i reconnect the psp they still dont exist? anyone??? ='( (i think its a problem with the VFAT file system the PSP uses)
what mount options are shown for the PSP?  Most likely, the user and umask need to be reset.
ive tryed as root and it still didnt work... what is umask?
umask is a mask that forces certain permission bits off.  Try 'mount -oremount,rw,umask=000,user=<your ID> <PSP dev>'
it automounts
its read like a mem stick or card reader
I know.  The command I typed is for atfer it has mounted, to see if those options make a difference.  If it does make a difference, then we update the settings for the automounter
oh ok
what goes in the psp dev bit of Try 'mount -oremount,rw,umask=000,user=<your ID> <PSP dev>'
either the device name or the mount point (/media/PSP or similar)
ohhh ok
nope =(
that didn't work at all?
it work, but its exactly the same prob as before
in that case, I am stumped:(
it mounts and seems to write to it, but doesnt (the writing bit is far to wuick on psp screen)
quick*
/dev/sdb1 on /media/usbdisk type vfat (rw,nosuid,nodev,quiet,shortname=winnt,uid=1000,gid=1000,umask=077,iocharset=utf8)
thats what i get
if i juts type mount
u sex then u sulk =/
if your uid is 1000, that *should* be correct.
well it looks like ive found something where i have to use a windows box for still =(
